message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.AI, cs.ST, cs.MS 

The paper deals with distance measures on probabilities and their applications in machine learning. Specifically, it discusses integral probability metrics (IPMs) and their relation to $\phi$-divergences, which are commonly used in machine learning. The paper also analyzes the consistency and convergence rates of empirical estimates of IPMs, which falls under the category of statistical learning theory (cs.LG) and information theory (cs.IT). The novel interpretation of IPMs in terms of binary classification suggests a connection to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper provides theoretical results on the smoothness of binary classifiers, which is related to statistical theory (cs.ST) and mathematical statistics (cs.MS).
